strategic_context.dual_purpose: Content must attract both (1) recruiters for Product/Marketing roles and (2) future agency clients, without explicitly selling services

primary_for_career.segment: Product & Marketing Hiring Managers at US Tech Companies
primary_for_career.why_primary: Career pivot target—need to attract these people to Diego's profile
characteristics: Looking for candidates with cross-functional experience
Want someone who understands GTM and can execute
Appreciate candidates who show their thinking publicly
what_they_look_for: Evidence of product thinking (not just sales metrics)
Ability to work across sales, product, and engineering
content_that_attracts_them: Frameworks for GTM and product alignment
Evidence of technical skills applied to business problems
signals_diego_should_send: Thinks in systems, not just deals
Builds internal tools (not just uses them)
Understands user problems, not just customer problems

primary_for_agency.why_primary: Future agency clients—need to build credibility now for 2026 launch

industries.rationale: High revenue, low tech adoption, underserved by AI consultants, willing to pay for results

problems_they_face: Drowning in admin work that doesn't generate revenue
Can't find or keep good employees
Know they should 'use AI' but don't know where to start
Tried tools that didn't stick or integrate
what_they_actually_need: Someone to just handle it for them
Systems that work without constant attention
Quick wins that prove value before big investment
Integration with tools they already use
Training simple enough for their team
content_that_attracts_them: Case studies from similar businesses (even if 'helping a friend')
Proof of understanding their specific industry challenges
how_to_reach_without_selling: Share 'what I learned helping a friend in HVAC'
Build in public without mentioning agency

secondary.segment: Sales & Product Leaders at B2B Companies
characteristics: Managing teams that need better alignment
Looking to leverage data and technology
secondary.relevance: Validates Diego's expertise but less likely to be direct clients or employers
secondary.content_overlap: Posts about product-sales alignment serve this audience while also attracting recruiters

for_career_audience.diego_counter: Shows product thinking, technical builds, and systems design
20+ projects built, shared publicly with lessons learned
Content explicitly bridges sales, product, and engineering perspectives

for_agency_audience.problem: Don't know where to start with AI
for_agency_audience.solution_frame: Start with the boring stuff—scheduling, follow-ups, reporting

for_agency_audience.problem: Tried AI tools and they didn't stick
for_agency_audience.solution_frame: Integration is the real work. The tool is 20%, the system is 80%.

for_agency_audience.problem: Too busy to learn new technology
for_agency_audience.solution_frame: You don't need to learn it. You need someone to build it for you.

for_agency_audience.problem: AI seems like it's for big companies
for_agency_audience.solution_frame: Boring businesses have the biggest opportunity—less competition, clearer wins

for_agency_audience.problem: Don't trust consultants who don't understand my business
for_agency_audience.solution_frame: Show specific knowledge of trades/services through content

objections_and_responses.objection: AI is too complex for our business
objections_and_responses.response_frame: The best AI implementations are invisible. Your team doesn't need to know it's AI—they just know the work got easier.

objections_and_responses.objection: We need the newest, most advanced technology
objections_and_responses.response_frame: The best stack isn't the newest one. It's the one that fits your workflow and your team will actually use.

objections_and_responses.objection: We don't have the budget for this
objections_and_responses.response_frame: Start with one process. Prove the ROI. Then expand. I'd rather automate one thing well than touch ten things badly.
AI replaces tasks, not people. Your best employee spends 30% of their time on admin. What if they got that back?

objections_and_responses.objection: We tried AI and it didn't work
objections_and_responses.response_frame: Most AI fails because of integration, not the AI itself. The tool worked fine—it just wasn't connected to anything.
Every industry thinks it's different. The problems are usually the same: scheduling, communication, follow-up, reporting.

shared_traits: Appreciate honesty about what works and what doesn't
trust_signals: Showing actual work, not just talking about concepts
Consistency over time (not just one viral post)

topics_that_serve_both_audiences.agency_angle: Shows what's possible for smaller teams
